newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Piltel down 8.06 pct, hits year-low.
newsitem.headline: Piltel down 8.06 pct, hits year-low.

text.p: Cellular phone company Pilipino Telephone Corp (Piltel) hit a year-low in mid-session on Thursday, shedding 1.25 pesos, or 8.06 percent, to 14.25 pesos due to disappointing 1996 earnings, brokers said.
"Of course, it's because of news about its worse-than-expected profits and nothing more," said Helen Alvarez, research director at All Asia Securities.
In a disclosure to the Securities and Exchange Commission on late Wednesday, Piltel reported a 1996 net profit of 710.468 million pesos against 822.075 million in the previous year.
Provision for doubtful accounts soared to 886.352 million pesos from 80.93 million in 1995 and an extraordinary income of 205.358 million pesos beefed up the company's bottomline, Piltel said.
The share price of Piltel has been on a downtrend since January and its previous year-low was at 15.25 pesos.
Piltel was the ninth most heavily-traded issue with 4.5 million shares changing hands valued at 65.56 million pesos in mid-session trading. - Manila newsroom 63 2 8418939 fax 8176267
